_template_info.name: Homodyne Static Isotropic Mode Configuration
_template_info.description: Specialized configuration for static isotropic scattering analysis
_template_info.based_on: config_template.json - specialized for isotropic static mode
_template_info.usage: Copy this template for isotropic static scattering experiments
key_features: Static mode with no flow effects
phi_angles_file not loaded - uses dummy angles
Only diffusion parameters (D0, alpha, D_offset) are relevant
Scaling optimization always enabled for proper chi-squared calculation

_scaling_optimization_benefits_isotropic.overview: Even in isotropic mode, scaling optimization (g₂ = offset + contrast × g₁) is essential
_scaling_optimization_benefits_isotropic.single_scaling: One scaling relationship applies to all 'angles' (isotropic averaging)
_scaling_optimization_benefits_isotropic.faster_computation: Simpler geometry but same mathematical rigor for chi-squared
_scaling_optimization_benefits_isotropic.robust_results: Accounts for instrumental factors even in simplified isotropic case

_when_to_use_this_template: Sample shows no angular dependence in scattering
No flow or rotation applied to sample
Focus on diffusion dynamics only (D0, alpha, D_offset)
Sample is liquid, powder, or isotropic solid

chi_squared_calculation._scaling_optimization_note: Scaling optimization is always enabled: g₂ = offset + contrast × g₁. This is essential for proper chi-squared calculation regardless of mode or number of angles.

_scaling_details._purpose: Performs least squares fitting to determine contrast and offset parameters
_scaling_details._chi_squared_formula: χ² = Σ(experimental - fitted)²/σ² where fitted = theory × contrast + offset
_scaling_details._implementation: Uses numpy.linalg.lstsq to solve A·x = b where A = [theory, ones], x = [contrast, offset]
_isotropic_mode_benefits: Single scaling relationship applied (no angular dependence)
Faster computation due to simplified geometry
Consistent results independent of sample orientation

Results are independent of scattering angle

when_to_use: Static samples with no applied flow or rotation

Quick analysis focusing only on diffusion dynamics
Systems where angular anisotropy is not expected or relevant
